products: Arts and Antique Objects (Especially those that are stolen, smuggled, or culturally sensitive)
Cultural Heritage Objects (Items illegally removed from archaeological sites or that belong to Tunisia's cultural heritage)
Objects of Religious Significance (Artifacts or religious items considered sacred or culturally important, especially those illegally exported)
Fossils and Rare Artifacts (Stolen fossils or items of prehistoric importance)
Palm trees, branch of palm trees, and their derivatives
Animals and plants threatened with extinction (under the 'CITES' convention), such as the sea turtle and chameleon
Narcotic drugs and other psychotropic products
Unregistered weight loss pills (e.g., certain herbal slimming products)
Fake erectile dysfunction drugs (e.g., counterfeit Viagra, Cialis)
Dextromethorphan (in high doses, found in some cough syrups)
Pseudoephedrine (found in some cold and flu medications)
Thrift stores (old and used clothes for commercial purposes)
Any item offensive to the Muslim culture
Hazardous Industrial Chemicals (Chemicals used in manufacturing processes without proper regulation or approval)
Banned Pesticides (Chemicals used in agriculture that have been banned due to their harmful effects on human health or the environment)
Toxic Chemicals (Substances with harmful or lethal effects that are not properly regulated)
Illegal Drugs & Narcotics (Substances like synthetic drugs that are chemically altered and fall under the category of illegal narcotics)
Unapproved Cosmetics Ingredients (Chemicals used in cosmetic products that have not been authorized for use, such as certain preservatives or colorants)
Chemical Weapons or Precursor Chemicals (Chemicals that could be used in the creation of chemical weapons)
Pollutants & Contaminants (Chemicals that are not approved and could contaminate water or air)
